placeholder-firebase: Enter firebase cloud messaging API key
env-admin-access-desc: Has access to all environments in this organization
tag-notifications-tooltip: The configured tags in the Feature Flag when was created. It will only notify you if the tags match the tag configured in the Feature Flag. When empty, it will notify you of any changes to all the flags.

notification-type.project: Get notified when someone adds or updates a project
notification-type.environment: Get notified when someone adds or updates an environment
notification-type.account: Get notified when someone adds or updates an account
notification-type.notification: Get notified when someone adds or updates a notification

goal-details.archive-desc: Once the goal is archived, it will only show on the list page when clicking on the Archived tab.
goal-details.delete-warning-desc: You cannot delete a goal when it has connections.
goal-details.archive-warning-desc: You cannot archive a goal when it has connections.

update-user-segment: Updating this field will replace the current list with the new one.
delete-user-segment-warning: This segment can’t be deleted because it is being used by {{count}} flag(s). Remove this segment from all flags before deleting it.
update-user-segment-warning: This segment is being used by {{count}} flag(s). If any of these flags are used in experiments, changing the segment may affect the accuracy of the results, since it could change which users are included in each variation. Please double-check before updating.
placeholder-enter-user-ids: Enter IDs separated by commas (E.g., userId1, userId2, userId3,...)

settings.in-this-experiment: <highlight>{{percent}}</highlight> of the target audience is in this experiment
settings.not-in-experiment: <highlight>{{percent}}</highlight> is not in this experiment and is served

define-audience.title: Define Audience
define-audience.audience-traffic-desc: Choose the percentage of the total audience to include in this allocation. The rest will be served the selected variation.
define-audience.variation-allocation-desc: Split the included audience among the variations.
define-audience.rule-defines: defines your experiment audience from the selected flag.
define-audience.any-traffic: Any traffic that does not match other targeting rules for the feature flag
define-audience.audience-amount: Set the audience amount to be included in the experiment
define-audience.not-included-allocation: Not included in this allocation <highlight>{{percent}}</highlight> will be served <select></select>
define-audience.not-in-experiment-served: Not in this experiment: <highlight>{{percent}}</highlight> will be served <select></select>
define-audience.advanced-prevent-variation: Prevent variation reassignment when traffic increases
define-audience.advanced-context-remain: User contexts remain assigned to their experiment variations during an iteration.

experiments.archive-desc: Once the experiment is archived, it will only show on the list page when clicking on the Archived tab.
experiments.archive-warning-desc: You cannot archive the experiment when it is running
experiments.goals-tooltip: The goal is the event you track to measure which variation performs better.
experiments.baseline-variation-tooltip: The baseline variation is the control group used as a reference to compare other variations in the experiment.

member-tags-tooltip: Tags can be used to group members making it easier when listing them on the list page
member-role-tooltip: Admin can do anything, but the Member role can't create or update Projects, Environments, API Keys, and Members.
no-tags-found: No tags were found in the selected environment

feature-flags.clone-desc: This will copy the targeting rules from the original flag to a new flag in the destination environment. The new flag will be created in a disabled state. Prerequisites, flag-based rules, and segment-based rules are not included.
feature-flags.schedule-info: You can update or delete the schedule on the Auto Operations tab on the Feature Flag details page.
feature-flags.conflict-rollout: There is a conflict with a Progressive Rollout Operation.
feature-flags.update-default-strategy: Update default rule strategy after stopping operation

variation.rollout-running-message: To update Variations, you must stop or delete the current <comp>Progressive Rollout</comp>.

placeholder-member-tags: Tags can be used to group members as teams
enter-to-add-multiple: Press enter to add multiple IDs.
user-attributes-desc: The same attributes will be applied to all the users in the list when evaluating them. User attributes are environment-specific. They are not shared between environments or projects.
flag-id-tooltip: Feature flag ID can only contain letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and hyphens (-). No spaces or special characters are allowed.
goal-id-tooltip: Goal ID can only contain letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and hyphens (-). No spaces or special characters are allowed.
tags-tooltip: Tags help optimize feature flag evaluations by limiting which flags are processed. Using specific tags improves response times and reduces network traffic. Tags are recommended for better performance as your system grows.
flag-type-tooltip: Select the data type for your feature flag's variations. This cannot be changed after creation.
clone-flag-desc: Cloning a flag copies its targeting rules to the destination environment and creates the flag in a disabled state. Prerequisites, flag-based rules, and segment-based rules are not copied.
archive-flag-desc: When a flag is archived, it will only appear on the list page when filters are applied and will be excluded from user evaluations.
unarchive-flag-desc: When a flag is unarchived, it will appear on the list page again and be included in user evaluations.
reset-sampling-tooltip: Re-randomizes all users with a new sampling seed, assigning fresh variations. Note that some users may still receive the same variation by chance.

event-rate-tooltip.variation: The specific variation to monitor. Bucketeer will track how often users assigned to this variation trigger the goal event.
event-rate-tooltip.goal: The target event (e.g. error, visit, conversion) used to calculate the event rate. This must be set up as a goal in your environment.
event-rate-tooltip.condition: The comparison used to evaluate the event rate. For example, ">= 5%" will trigger the kill switch if the rate meets or exceeds 5%.
event-rate-tooltip.threshold:
The event rate percentage that must be met to trigger the kill switch. Calculated as:
(Goal Event Count) / (Evaluation Count for the Variation)
event-rate-tooltip.min-count: The minimum number of events required before the condition is evaluated. Helps avoid false triggers from small sample sizes.

rollout-warning-title: The progressive rollout cannot be created. Please check the following conditions.
rollout-warning-desc: Cannot execute more than one progressive rollout at the same time.
more-info-see-document: For more information, please see the <comp>Documentation.</comp>
rollout-experiment-warning: To create a Progressive Rollout, you must stop the current <comp>Experiment.</comp>
rollout-variations-warning: The flag must have only 2 variations.
rollout-enable-flag: Progressive Rollout will enable the flag when it starts.
rollout-manual-desc: Configure each rollout step manually. You define the variation, the percentage of users to receive it, and the exact time for each step to execute.
rollout-template-desc: Automate a multi-step rollout by setting a starting time, percentage increment, and rollout frequency. The system will schedule and apply each phase based on your inputs.

template.variation: Select the variation to roll out over time. Avoid using the same variation configured as the OFF variation to prevent evaluation issues.
template.start-date: The date and time when the first rollout phase begins.
template.increment: The percentage increase applied to each rollout phase. For example, using 10% will divide the rollout into 10 equal stages.
template.frequency: The time interval between each rollout phase. Based on the Start Date, Bucketeer will automatically release each stage hourly, daily, or weekly.

manual.variation: Select the variation to gradually roll out. This must be different from the OFF variation to prevent conflicts during evaluation.
manual.weight: The percentage of users who will receive this variation when this phase is executed.
manual.execute-at: The exact date and time when this rollout phase will take effect, updating the user distribution.

has-rollout-running: There is a <comp>Progressive Rollout</comp> in progress. It will stop it.

targeting.flag-switch-on: Flag is <switch></switch> serving variations based on rules
targeting.flag-switch-off: Flag is <switch></switch> serving the off variation
targeting.flag-off-desc: The flag is off, and no audience traffic will evaluate the rules below.
targeting.custom-rule-tooltip: Combine user attributes, segments, and feature flags for a specific audience.
targeting.default-rule-desc: When targeting is ON and contexts don't match any targeting rules
targeting.prerequisite-flags: This flag is a prerequisite of {{quantity}} other {{flag}}.
targeting.prerequisite-flags-used-by: This flag is used by other flags
targeting.prerequisite-flags-used-by-desc: You can't archive this flag because it's used as a prerequisite or in a custom rule by the following flags.
targeting.prerequisite-flags-used-by-desc-two: Please remove it from those flags first, then try archiving again.
targeting.prerequisite-flags-desc: Changes to the targeting rules may affect the variations served by the {{text}} below.
targeting.rollout-running-message: To update the Default Strategy, you must stop or delete the current <comp>Progressive Rollout</comp>.

tooltip.flag-on: Flag is ON. Users are evaluated in order: Prerequisites → Individual Targets → Rules → Default Rule.
tooltip.flag-off: Flag is OFF.  All users will receive the selected "Off variation" regardless of prerequisites, individual targets, or rules.
tooltip.prerequisites: Specify other feature flags that must be enabled and return a specific variation for this flag to be evaluated. If any prerequisite fails, this flag returns the off variation.
tooltip.individual-target: Target specific users directly by their user ID (Unique ID). These users will receive the selected variation regardless of rules or rollout conditions.
tooltip.custom-rules: Define conditions based on user attributes (e.g., app version, genre) to assign variations. Rules are evaluated in order, and the first matching rule determines the variation.
tooltip.default-rule: If no prerequisites, targets, or custom rules match, users will receive the variation defined here. This acts as the fallback behavior for all other users.
tooltip.attribute: The user attribute used for targeting. This must match the attribute passed when initializing the client SDK (e.g., appVersion, genre, os).
tooltip.value: One or more expected values for the selected attribute. If the user's attribute matches any of these values, the condition will evaluate as true.
tooltip.debugger: The debugger can verify what variation will be assigned to a specific end-user under different conditions in real-time.
tooltip.audience: All end-users will be evaluated against the targeting rules. If no rules match, the default rule will determine which variation they receive.

no-opts-type-to-create: No options. Type to create a new one.
type-to-create: Type to create a new one.
teams-tooltip: Teams can be used to group members, making it easier when listing them on the list page
env-url-tooltip: The URL code will be used as part of the management console's URL, so it must be unique across all projects. It can contain lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens (-), up to a maximum of 50 characters.
project-url-tooltip: The Project's URL code is used as part of the management console's URL. It must be unique within the organization. It can contain lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens (-), up to 50 characters.
type-to-create-user-id: Type to create a user ID.
upload-files-error: Some files could not be uploaded because they are in unsupported formats. Please check the allowed file types and try again.
firebase-service-account-tooltip: This is the JSON key for your Firebase service account. Bucketeer uses it to authenticate with Firebase and send push notifications to your app via FCM.
feature-flag-tags-tooltip: Used to match feature flags to this FCM integration. If a flag has a tag that matches this setting, a push notification will be sent. If no tag is set here, notifications will be sent for all flags that don't have tags.
flag-search-placeholder: Search by name, ID, or description...
yaml-note: YAML values are compiled into a JSON structure before user evaluation and are returned to the client SDK through the object variation interface, just like JSON flags.
auto-archive-enable-tooltip: When enabled, feature flags that meet the specified criteria will be automatically archived by the daily batch job.
auto-archive-policy-info: This policy applies to all flags in this environment. Flags set as prerequisites for other flags are excluded from automatic archiving.
auto-archive-check-code-refs-tooltip: Code references track where feature flags are used in your codebase. This feature requires setting up the Bucketeer CLI to scan your code and report flag usage. When enabled, flags with active code references will not be archived automatically. You can view code references in the Feature Flag Details page under the 'Code Refs' tab.

operation.confirm-stop-desc: Stopping or deleting this rollout at its current stage will change how traffic is routed between variations. Traffic will be redistributed using the default rule percentage rollout settings.
operation.confirm-stop-title: Audience traffic allocation will be updated
